dt: {bc}to apply smoke, vapor, or gas to especially for the purpose of disinfecting or of destroying pests

et: borrowed from Latin {it}fūmigātus,{/it} past participle of {it}fūmigāre{/it} "to subject to smoke, get rid of with smoke," from {it}fūmus{/it} "smoke" + {it}-igāre,{/it} causative suffix, probably generalized from {it}rēmigāre{/it} "to use oars, row," verbal derivative of {it}rēmig-, rēmex{/it} "oarsman, rower," from {it}rēmus{/it} "oar" + {it}-ig-, -ex,{/it} agent noun derivative from the base of {it}agere{/it} "to be in motion, do, perform" {ma}{mat|fume:1|}, {mat|agent|}{/ma}
shortdef: to apply smoke, vapor, or gas to especially for the purpose of disinfecting or of destroying pests
